result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Scheduling conference on October 31, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

OFF RECORD/ 11:04 AM Defendant Nicholas E Baker not in court.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman appeared by video for Nicholas E Baker.  Attorney Jennifer Gross in court for State of Wisconsin. Court Discussion speaks on court record and proceedings. Atty Erdman to contact the JA for scheduling. 
Review scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 08:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant
Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
11:23 AM Court calls case and recites appearances. Defendant Nicholas E Baker appeared by video from SWSO jail.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman appeared by video for Nicholas E Baker.  Attorney Jennifer Gross in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Erdman waives reading, requests pre-lim, waives time limits.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 11:00 am.

11:32 AM Defendant Nicholas E Baker appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman appeared by video for Nicholas E Baker.  Attorney Jennifer Gross appeared for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances.   Attny Erdman indicates to proceed with preliminary hearing.    State calls witness, City of Hayward Officer D. Saraniecki, sworn in by court.   State begins examination.  11:48 AM  Witness identified the DEF, court indicates the record will reflect.  State continues examination.  11:52 AM  Cross-Examination by Attorney Erdman.   11:55 AM  State objection, not testimony.  Court allows.  Cross examination continues.    Attny Erdman no further questions. 11:56 AM  Witness excused.   No further witness by either party.   State request for bind over.  Attny Erdman no argument.  Court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial.
Arraignment scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 11:00 am.

11:27 AM Defendant Nicholas E Baker appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman appeared by video.   Attorney Jennifer Gross in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances.  Attny Erdman recently appointed and request reschedule.  State waiting for officer to appear to testify.  Court addresses DEF, DEF agrees to extend time limits.  Court makes statement and reset.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 11:45 am.
Preliminary hearing on May 23, 2022 at 11:45 am.
PFAC DENIED - qualifies for public defender

8:30 AM Defendant Nicholas E Baker appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jennifer Gross in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances.  DEF completed court appointed attorney paperwork.   DEF to proceed with initial appearance today.  DEF received copy of criminal complaint in court on this date.  DEF verifies DOB and address. Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint, wishes to contact counsel.  Court enters NG Plea to Count 2, 3, and 4. DEF requests preliminary hearing within time limits.   DEF request bond reduction, Court indicates DEF can discuss with Attorney when appointed. Bond Continues.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 20, 2022 at 11:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on May 20, 2022 at 11:15 am.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: CASH BOND RETURNED FROM JAIL MARKED REFUSED AS DEFENDANT REFUSED TO SIGN BOND.

11:27 AM Defendant Nicholas Baker  in court, in custody appears by video.  Attny Jaclyn Shelton (special appearance) appear in court by video (SPD Attny).  Kenneth  Sortedahl appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Probable Cause found by court. DE does not  qualify for PD appointment.  State makes bond recommendation.  Attny Shelton  argues bond.   Court sets bond.  CBS $2500  No Contact M.B.  dob 1/25/2001  and J.S.  dob: 11/8/1988  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption of Alcoholic Beverages.  May not possess any controlled substance or paraphernalia.     No drug use without a valid prescription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered.  

Defendant shall be subject to testing of their blood, breath, saliva and/or urine to ensure compliance with absolute sobriety provision. Within 24 hours of release from custody (not including weekends/holidays) defendant shall report to Justice Point Pre-Trial Services at 10610 Main Street Suite 101, Hayward, WI 54843. Phone: 715-804-0109 OR 715-338-3976 for orientation and to establish testing procedures and options.    INITIAL APPEARANCE set for  May 10, 2022  @ 8:30 AM
